com.caffeineowl.googlemaps.automation.pageobjects.ctxes

Class DirectionsPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.caffeineowl.googlemaps.automation.pageobjects.PageContext
      • com.caffeineowl.googlemaps.automation.pageobjects.ctxes.DirectionsPage

  • public class DirectionsPage
extends PageContext

    The "automation utility class" for the "maps.google.com" to cover the "get travel directions" page.

    Contains the UI element locators for the as protected methods and the "automation logic" as public elements. Currently still incomplete (but a slightly larger coverage of the elements and logic than the HomePage:

    1. the main "search scenario" is covered (at the route summary level only) fir success
    2. one limit case is covered as well: of one start/dest point is correct, the other one is a wrong value (the place does not exists)
    Lots of other things still to cover: the details of the listed routes, traveling by way points, limit cases in which both the start/destination are incorrect, destination unreacheable from the source by chosen travel mode, etc.

      POJO class packing the details of a proposed route.
      static class  DirectionsPage.TravelMode

      • navigateTo

        public void navigateTo(PageEnum page)
        Description copied from class: PageContext

        This is where a SiteMap class may come handy; I mean… rather than returning void, maybe it's the SiteMap class to handle various pages via a method called attachPage which would automatically PageContext.checkContextElements()

        But this may be a suboptimal design! Rationale: we are not handling simple pages, but states/transitions here; a proper approach would be to describe the states and possible transitions. Then, ask the test environ to travel all and any edge of the graph for 100% coverage. Eh, one can only dream!
        Specified by:
        navigateTo in class PageContext
